file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-50-02-04 - CARGO NET - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CARGO NET - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the cargo net assembly. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 25-50-02-000-801-A CARGO NET ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL ALL 25-50-02-400-801-A CARGO NET ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 25-50-02 Page 1 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-50-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. CARGO NET ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the cargo restraint net or the cargo vertical barrier net. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 52-30-00/1 C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Open the baggage door (AMM SDS 52-30-00/1). (2) On aircraft with cargo restraint net installed, remove it as follows (Figure 401): (a) Release the tiedown fitting (6) from the anchor plate (5). Refer to DET. D, sheet 2. (b) Release the locking hook (3) from the ring (4) to release the middle cargo restraint net from the forward cargo restraint net and the aft cargo restraint net. Refer to DET. A, sheet 1 and DET. C, sheet 2. (c) If it is necessary to remove the floor anchor plate assemblies (5), do steps 1 and 2 below. Refer to DET. D, sheet 2: 1 Remove the screws (9). Refer to DET. E, sheet 2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-50-02 Page 2 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL 2 Remove the anchor plate (8) and the anchor plate cup (7). Refer to DET. E, sheet 2. (3) On aircraft with cargo vertical barrier net installed, remove it as follows (Figure 402): (a) Release the tiedown fittings (3) and (9) from the anchor plates (2) and (8). Refer to DET. C and D. (b) If it is necessary to remove the floor anchor plate assemblies (8), do steps 1 and 2 below. Refer to DET. E. 1 Remove the screws (7). 2 Remove the anchor plate (6) and the anchor plate cup (5). (c) If it is necessary to remove the baggage lining anchor plate assemblies (2), do steps 1 and 2 below. Refer to DET. C. 1 Remove the screws (4). 2 Remove the anchor plate (2). (4) Close the baggage door (AMM SDS 52-30-00/1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-50-02 Page 3 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

TIEDOWN FITTING D E DET. D 8. ANCHOR PLATE 7. SCREW ASSEMBLY 6. ANCHOR PLATE DET. B D 5. ANCHOR PLATE 2. ANCHOR PLATE CUP 4. SCREW LINING CARPET (REF.) (REF.) 3. TIEDOWN FITTING DET. C DET. E 145AMM250124.MCE C EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 25-50-02 Page 6 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-50-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. CARGO NET ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the cargo restraint net or the cargo vertical barrier net. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 52-30-00/1 C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Open the baggage door (AMM SDS 52-30-00/1). (2) On aircraft with cargo restraint net installed, install it as follows (Figure 401): (a) If applicable, attach the cargo restraint net to the retaining strip (10). Refer to DET. B, sheet 2. (b) If you removed the floor anchor plate assemblies (5), do steps 1 and 2 below. Refer to DET. D, sheet 2: 1 Install the anchor plate cup (7) and the anchor plate (8). Refer to DET. E, sheet 2. 2 Attach them with the screws (9). Refer to DET. E, sheet 2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-50-02 Page 7 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (c) Tighten the locking hook (3) to the ring (4) to tighten the middle cargo restraint net to the forward cargo restraint net and the aft cargo restraint net. Refer to DET. A, sheet 1 and DET. C, sheet 2. (d) Tighten the tiedown fitting (6) to the anchor plate (5). Refer to DET. D, sheet 2. (3) On aircraft with cargo vertical barrier net installed, install it as follows (Figure 402): (a) If you removed the baggage lining anchor plate assemblies (2), do steps 1 and 2 below. Refer to DET. C. 1 Install the anchor plate (2). 2 Attach it with the screws (4). (b) If you removed the floor anchor plate assemblies (8), do steps 1 and 2 below. Refer to DET. E. 1 Install the anchor plate cup (5) and the anchor plate (6). 2 Attach them with the screws (7). (c) Tighten the tiedown fittings (3) and (9) to the anchor plates (2) and (8). Refer to DET. C and D. (4) Close the baggage door (AMM SDS 52-30-00/1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 25-50-02 Page 8 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
